alert.note: Alert for Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:08AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Randall County through 545 AM CDT... At 508 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Happy, or 9 miles southeast of Canyon, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Randall County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
